required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Surufatinib in Recurrent/Metastatic Head and Neck Adenocarcinomas
clinical_study.official_title: A Study of Surufatinib in the Treatment of Recurrent/Metastatic Adenocarcinomas of the Head and Neck

lead_sponsor.agency: Shanghai Ninth People's Hospital Affiliated to Shanghai Jiao Tong University

clinical_study.source: Shanghai Ninth People's Hospital Affiliated to Shanghai Jiao Tong University

brief_summary.textblock: This is a non-randomized, phase II, open label study of Surufatinib hydrochloride capsules in recurrent/metastatic adenocarcinomas of head and neck. The primary purpose of this study is to evaluate the efficacy of anlotinib.

clinical_study.condition: Head and Neck Cancers - Salivary Gland

intervention.description: Patients receive oral Surufatinib at a dose of 300mg/d (once-daily dosing continuously, every 28-day treatment cycle), The curative effect was evaluated every 8 weeks.
